info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 1:48PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...MULTIPLE STRONG THUNDERSTORMS PRODUCING TORRENTIAL RAINFALL, HAIL, FREQUENT LIGHTNING, AND GUSTY WINDS ACROSS THE SOUTH CENTRAL HIGHLANDS... At 145 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from 9 miles south of Fort Hall Bannock Peak to 14 miles north of Juniper to 10 miles northeast of Park Valley. Movement was south at 10 MPH. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, winds in excess of 40 MPH, penny size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rockland, Fort Hall Bannock Peak, Juniper, Pauline, Arbon, Sublett Reservoir, Roy and Sweetzer Summit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flood Advisory is also in effect for the area through 430 PM MDT Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If you observe flooding, debris flows, hail, or wind damage, please report your observations to the National Weather Service in Pocatello via phone, email, or social media, as soon as it is safe to do so.
